parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.40

</value></part><part><name>gr1 </name>=<value> Multiplayer

</value></part><part><name>serverExec</name>=<value> server

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Changes the ownership of a group (and all its units) to a given client. The group leader must not be a player. This command only works when called from the server. Returns true if locality was changed. For [[agents]] use [[setOwner]] command.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> group [[setGroupOwner]] clientID

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> group: [[Group]] -

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> clientID: [[Number]] - the [[Multiplayer_Scripting#Machine_network_ID | machine network ID]] of the new [[owner]].

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_localityChanged = _someGroup [[setGroupOwner]] ([[owner]] _playerObject);</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[owner]], [[setOwner]], [[groupOwner]]
</value></part></template>


<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">

<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 30, 2015 - 12:49 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:IT07|IT07]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
In <template><title>arma3</title></template> 1.48, setGroupOwner does NOT work if group has no units
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on April 28, 2020 - 22:58 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[https://forums.bohemia.net/profile/1117131-tmzulu/ TMZulu]</dt>
<dd class="note">
The [[setGroupOwner]] command will dismount the unit leader of a vehicle if the vehicle is stationary, likely due to the dummy waypoint used in the transfer.<br>
[[lock|Locking]] the vehicle during transfer can counter this behavior.
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on April 30, 2020 - 21:15 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:TMZulu|TMZulu]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Using '''setGroupOwner''' may cause AI to have their loadout removed. This typically occurs when transferring multiple groups in sequence without delay. This occurs on seemingly random AI in groups. The simple but finicky solution to this is to add a sufficient delay between the transfer of groups. Alternatively, one could have the units' loadouts saved and then reloaded if the unit is shown as naked. Both of these methods may be combined as well.
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on April 30, 2020 - 21:58 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:TMZulu|TMZulu]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
Locality dependent commands such as '''forceSpeed''' will no longer work after transfer and must be reapplied on the owning client.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
